title: Are oral contracts for a promise to give stock options part of the statute of frauds?
question: Is a written instrument necessary for a contract where party A gives stock options to party B in payment for past debts? Is this part of the statute of frauds?
answers:
If it is in excess of $500 or will be more than a year out in performance, yes it is subject to the statute of frauds and must be in writing. That may be the least of your issues.

Stock options are not a do it yourself project. 99% of the corporations or LLCs I review are defectively formed, in part because non-attorneys don't know how to issue stock, much less stock options.
